\/D:\/repos\/rr\/source\/manual\/particl: This walkthrough shows how you can create custom extensions for the particle system, providing functionality not available in the core engine.
Este passo mostra como você pode criar extensões personalizadas para o sistema de partículas, fornecendo funcionalidade não disponível no motor central.
This walkthrough shows how you can create custom extensions for the particle system, providing functionality not available in the core engine.
If you're not familiar with editing particles, see <g1>Create particles</g1>.
Se você não estiver familiarizado com as partículas de edição, veja as partículas <g1>Create</g1>.
If you're not familiar with editing particles, see <g1>Create particles</g1>.
This project contains different scenes that demonstrate different ways to use particles.
Este projeto contém diferentes cenas que demonstram diferentes formas de usar partículas.
This project contains different scenes that demonstrate different ways to use particles.
There are three particle entities in the scene:
Há três entidades de partículas no local:
There are three particle entities in the scene:
Select one of the particle entities.
Selecione uma das entidades de partículas.
Select one of the particle entities.
In the Property Grid, navigate to its source particle system and expand the emitter.
Na Grade de Propriedade, navegue até seu sistema de partículas de origem e expanda a emissora.
In the Property Grid, navigate to its source particle system and expand the emitter.
There are four custom elements in this emitter:
Há quatro elementos personalizados neste emissor:
There are four custom elements in this emitter:
The custom <g1>spawner</g1> is similar to the spawn-per-second spawner, but also emits a burst of particles every time it loops.
O personalizado <g1>spawner</g1> é semelhante ao spawner-por-segundo, mas também emite uma explosão de partículas cada vez que ele loops.
The custom <g1>spawner</g1> is similar to the spawn-per-second spawner, but also emits a burst of particles every time it loops.
The custom <g1>initializer</g1> initially positions the particles in a cone shape and sets their velocity accordingly.
O personalizado <g1>inicializador</g1> inicialmente posiciona as partículas em uma forma de cone e define sua velocidade de acordo.
The custom <g1>initializer</g1> initially positions the particles in a cone shape and sets their velocity accordingly.
The custom <g1>updater</g1> operates on a new particle field named <g2>RactangleXY</g2>, allowing the shape builder to use non-uniform sizes when building the billboards.
O personalizado <g1>updater</g1> opera em um novo campo de partículas chamado <g2>RactangleXY</g2>, permitindo que o construtor de formas use tamanhos não uniformes ao construir os outdoors.
The custom <g1>updater</g1> operates on a new particle field named <g2>RactangleXY</g2>, allowing the shape builder to use non-uniform sizes when building the billboards.
The custom <g1>shape builder</g1> is similar to the billboard with two additions.
O custom <g1>shape builder</g1> é semelhante ao outdoor com duas adições.
The custom <g1>shape builder</g1> is similar to the billboard with two additions.
It can create non-uniform rectangles, rather than the standard squares, and it can align (fix) the rectangle's Y axis to the world's Y axis rather than the camera space.
Ele pode criar retângulos não uniformes, em vez dos quadrados padrão, e pode alinhar (fixar) o eixo Y do retângulo para o eixo Y do mundo em vez do espaço da câmera.
It can create non-uniform rectangles, rather than the standard squares, and it can align (fix) the rectangle's Y axis to the world's Y axis rather than the camera space.
We'll create a spawner which emits particles per second <g1>and</g1> in bursts every few seconds.
Vamos criar um spawner que emite partículas por segundo <g1> e</g1> em rajadas a cada poucos segundos.
We'll create a spawner which emits particles per second <g1>and</g1> in bursts every few seconds.
We could do this by adding two different spawners, but for this sample we'll combine them.
Podemos fazer isso adicionando dois spawners diferentes, mas para esta amostra vamos combiná-los.
We could do this by adding two different spawners, but for this sample we'll combine them.

This class mimics the @'Stride.Particles.Spawners.ParticleSpawner', with the addition of a <g1>BurstCount</g1> and a <g2>burstTimer</g2> to control how often and how many particles are spawned in bursts.

Esta classe imita o @'Stride.Particles.Spawners.ParticleSpawner', com a adição de um <g1>BurstCount</g1> e um <g2>burstTimer</g2> para controlar com que frequência e quantas partículas são geradas em explosões.

This class mimics the @'Stride.Particles.Spawners.ParticleSpawner', with the addition of a <g1>BurstCount</g1> and a <g2>burstTimer</g2> to control how often and how many particles are spawned in bursts.
The <g1>SpawnNew</g1> method is called every frame to allow the spawner to calculate how many new particles should be emitted in the emitter based on the elapsed time.
O método <g1>SpawnNew</g1> é chamado cada quadro para permitir que o proprietário calcule quantas novas partículas devem ser emitidas na emissora com base no tempo decorrido.
The <g1>SpawnNew</g1> method is called every frame to allow the spawner to calculate how many new particles should be emitted in the emitter based on the elapsed time.
As an exercise, try implementing the following changes:
Como exercício, tente implementar as seguintes alterações:
As an exercise, try implementing the following changes:
Rather than one-second bursts, create a property and have the user control the timing.
Em vez de um segundo rajadas, criar uma propriedade e ter o usuário control o tempo.
Rather than one-second bursts, create a property and have the user control the timing.
Remove the spawn-per-second fields and make it a pure burst spawner.
Remova os campos espawn-per-second e torná-lo um spawner de explosão puro.
Remove the spawn-per-second fields and make it a pure burst spawner.
Our spawner only emits particles, but doesn't set any fields.
Nosso spawner apenas emite partículas, mas não define nenhum campo.
Our spawner only emits particles, but doesn't set any fields.
This is done by the initializer.
This is done by the initializer.
We want to place the particles in a cone and shoot them outwards when they spawn.
Queremos colocar as partículas em um cone e atirar neles para fora quando eles desovam.
We want to place the particles in a cone and shoot them outwards when they spawn.

anula de sobreposição inseguro público Inicialize(PartePool pool, int startIdx, int endIdx, int maxCapacity)
public unsafe override void Initialize(ParticlePool pool, int startIdx, int endIdx, int maxCapacity)
Our initializer simply defines an angle for the cone and strength for the velocity.
Nosso inicializador simplesmente define um ângulo para o cone e força para a velocidade.
Our initializer simply defines an angle for the cone and strength for the velocity.
Any scaling and rotation of the cone come from the location inheritance and offset, which are common for all initializers and updaters and are ready to use.
Qualquer escala e rotação do cone vêm da herança de localização e deslocamento, que são comuns para todos os inicializadores e atualizadores e estão prontos para usar.
Any scaling and rotation of the cone come from the location inheritance and offset, which are common for all initializers and updaters and are ready to use.
Para obter mais informações, consulte o @'Stride.Particles.Initializers.ParticleInitializer'.
The constructor for the initializer is important, as it sets the list of required fields we'll use.
O construtor para o inicializador é importante, pois define a lista de campos necessários que usaremos.
The constructor for the initializer is important, as it sets the list of required fields we'll use.
The initializer sets the particle's position and velocity, so we add those, and needs to generate some randomness, so we also add the random seed which we are going to use.
O inicializador define a posição e a velocidade da partícula, então adicionamos esses, e precisa gerar alguma aleatoriedade, então também adicionamos a semente aleatória que vamos usar.
The initializer sets the particle's position and velocity, so we add those, and needs to generate some randomness, so we also add the random seed which we are going to use.
All particles have <g1>Life</g1> and <g2>RandomSeed</g2> fields when they spawn.
Todas as partículas têm campos <g1>Life</g1> e <g2>RandomSeed</g2> quando elas surgiram.
All particles have <g1>Life</g1> and <g2>RandomSeed</g2> fields when they spawn.

Rather than updating all of them, we are given a starting and end indices and must only use particles in the defined range.

We want our updater to change a particle's width and height every frame based on a simple sine function over the particle's life.

The field has type @'Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2', since we only need two values for the width and the height.

The field has type @'Stride.Core.Mathematics.Vector2', since we only need two values for the width and the height.
No fields are added automatically to the particles, so even if you have many declarations, the particle size won't change.
Nenhum campo é adicionado automaticamente às partículas, por isso mesmo que você tenha muitas declarações, o tamanho da partícula não mudará.
No fields are added automatically to the particles, so even if you have many declarations, the particle size won't change.
Fields are only added when we plug a module which requires them, such as the custom updater below.
Os campos só são adicionados quando conectamos um módulo que os requer, como o atualizador personalizado abaixo.
Fields are only added when we plug a module which requires them, such as the custom updater below.

public override int QuadsPerParticle { get; protected set; } = 1;
override público int QuadsPerParticle { get; protected set; } = 1;
public override int QuadsPerParticle { get; protected set; } = 1;
The engine draws quads using 1 quad = 4 vertices = 6 indices, but we can only specify the number of quads we need.
O motor desenha quads usando 1 quad = 4 vértices = 6 índices, mas só podemos especificar o número de quads que precisamos.
The engine draws quads using 1 quad = 4 vertices = 6 indices, but we can only specify the number of quads we need.
For a rectangle we need only one.
Para um retângulo precisamos apenas de um.
For a rectangle we need only one.
The number of quads is important because the vertex buffer is allocated and mapped prior to writing out the vertex data.
O número de quads é importante porque o buffer de vértice é alocado e mapeado antes de escrever os dados do vértice.
The number of quads is important because the vertex buffer is allocated and mapped prior to writing out the vertex data.
If we allocate smaller buffer it might result in illegal memory access and corruption.
Se alocarmos um buffer menor pode resultar em acesso ilegal de memória e corrupção.
If we allocate smaller buffer it might result in illegal memory access and corruption.

Our particles' width and height depend both on the uniform size field <g1>Size</g1> and the field we created earlier in this walkthrough, <g2>RectangleXY</g2>.
A largura e a altura das nossas partículas dependem tanto do campo de tamanho uniforme <g1>Size</g1> e do campo que criamos anteriormente neste avanço, <g2>RectangleXY</g2>.

From there, we need to set the positions and texture coordinates for the four corner vertices of our quad.
A partir daí, precisamos definir as posições e coordenadas de textura para os quatro vértices de canto do nosso quad.
From there, we need to set the positions and texture coordinates for the four corner vertices of our quad.
The number of vertices we have to set is per particle four times the number of quads we requested.
O número de vértices que temos de definir é por partícula quatro vezes o número de quads que pedimos.
The number of vertices we have to set is per particle four times the number of quads we requested.
You can add more complicated shapes or attributes here if your game requires them.
Você pode adicionar formas ou atributos mais complicados aqui se o seu jogo requerê-los.
You can add more complicated shapes or attributes here if your game requires them.
With these 4 custom modules you can add a lot of functionality to the particle engine and tailor behavior to your needs.
Com esses 4 módulos personalizados, você pode adicionar muita funcionalidade ao mecanismo de partículas e adaptar o comportamento às suas necessidades.
With these 4 custom modules you can add a lot of functionality to the particle engine and tailor behavior to your needs.
Because they're all serialized and loaded in Game Studio, once you create them, you can use them directly from Game Studio, together with the core modules.
Porque todos eles são serializados e carregados no Game Studio, uma vez que você os cria, você pode usá-los diretamente no Game Studio, juntamente com os módulos principais.
Because they're all serialized and loaded in Game Studio, once you create them, you can use them directly from Game Studio, together with the core modules.
If you want to experiment with the modules, try adding a new <g1>.cs</g1> file to the <g2>CustomParticles.Game</g2> project.
Se você quiser experimentar os módulos, tente adicionar um novo arquivo <g1>.cs</g1> para o <g2>CustomParticles. Projeto Game</g2>.
If you want to experiment with the modules, try adding a new <g1>.cs</g1> file to the <g2>CustomParticles.Game</g2> project.
You can duplicate one of the existing classes, but don't forget to change the class name and the data contract to avoid collisions.
Você pode duplicar uma das classes existentes, mas não se esqueça de alterar o nome da classe e o contrato de dados para evitar colisões.
You can duplicate one of the existing classes, but don't forget to change the class name and the data contract to avoid collisions.
You can then reload the scripts in Game Studio.
Você pode então recarregar os scripts no Game Studio.
You can then reload the scripts in Game Studio.
If they don't load, relaunch your project.
Se eles não carregarem, relança o seu projeto.
If they don't load, relaunch your project.
If there are no compilation errors in your code you should see the new modules in the spawners, initializers, updaters and shape builders lists.
Se não houver erros de compilação em seu código, você deve ver os novos módulos nas listas de proprietários, inicializadores, atualizadores e construtores de formas.
If there are no compilation errors in your code you should see the new modules in the spawners, initializers, updaters and shape builders lists.
